<jggilbert@...> writes:

> Rich and Milt, I've seen plenty worse, too.  For real, high quality
> Mino (or Goto) tsuba the color of the shakudo is pure black without a
> trace of brown.  The carving is very crisp and precise, the nanako
> perfectly formed and the gold thick with rich color.

I had also been told that the carving was very deep. Lesser stuff is not
carved so deeply.

http://www.xhasc.com/nihonto/kashira.jpg

Is my example. The bug there is so high off the background he's casting
quite a shadow.

- darcy
